    • Method Detail

      • addOrUpdateThemeDescriptor

        public void addOrUpdateThemeDescriptor(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<ThemeDescriptorResponse> callback)
        Creates or updates a theme descriptor that can be used to give applications a customized look and feel. The theme can be created by consumers and shared to other users, allowing them to use and/or collaborate on making the theme.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/theme

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.themeDescriptorId
          the theme descriptor id used to update an existing theme, leave empty for creating a new theme
        • SirqulKeys.title
          the title of the theme
        • SirqulKeys.description
          the description of the theme
        • SirqulKeys.publicRead
          determines whether the theme's participants have read permissions
        • SirqulKeys.publicWrite
          determines whether the theme's participants have write permissions
        • SirqulKeys.publicDelete
          determines whether the theme's participants have delete permissions
        • SirqulKeys.publicAdd
          determines whether the theme's participants have add permissions
        • SirqulKeys.visibility
          the determines the theme's participants (PUBLIC - includes everyone in the system as a potential participant, PRIVATE - only considers people who have been invited as participants)
        • SirqulKeys.connectionIdsToAdd
          a comma separated list of connection IDs to share to users
        • SirqulKeys.connectionGroupIdsToAdd
          a comma separated list of connection group IDs to share to groups
        • SirqulKeys.includeFriendGroup
          flag to determine whether to share to the user's "friends" group
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          the application version the theme was created for. AppVersion
        • SirqulKeys.colorValueJson
          a json array used to replace colors withing the application
          Example : [ {"name": "sceneAtlas", "valueString": "100,100,100,255"}, {"name": "bg","valueString": "100,100,100,255"} ]
        • SirqulKeys.stringReplacerJson
          a json array used to replace strings within the application
          Example: [ {"name" : "coins", "valueString" : "Gems" }, {"name" : "lives", "valueString" : "lives" } ]
        • SirqulKeys.customJsonObjects
          a json object used by the scene atlas to position sprites
          Example: { "pShootingOffset": [ { "name": "x", "valueString": "2.2" }, { "name": "y", "valueString": "-0.3" } ], "e1ShootingOffset": [ { "name": "x", "valueString": "0.25" }, { "name": "y", "valueString": "0.5" } ] }
        • SirqulKeys.iconImageFilePath
          the icon image file path containing the image used as the theme icon
        • SirqulKeys.sceneAtlasImageFilePath
          the scene atlas image file path containing the scene atlas
        • SirqulKeys.bgImageFilePath
          the bg image file path containing the background image
        • SirqulKeys.bgSoundFilePath
          the bg sound file path containing the background sound file (preferably in MP3 format)
        • SirqulKeys.musicSelection
          used to select a default sound file that already exists in the application
        • SirqulKeys.completeWithDefaultValues
          determines whether to use default values to complete the theme
        • SirqulKeys.locationDescription
          the description of the user's current location
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ThemeDescriptorResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ThemeDescriptorApiBase.addOrUpdateThemeDescriptor

      • getThemeDescriptor

        public void getThemeDescriptor(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<PurchaseItemListResponse> callback)
        Gets a theme

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/theme/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.themeDescriptorId
          the theme id
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location used to update the user's current location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        PurchaseItemListResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ThemeDescriptorApiBase.getThemeDescriptor

      • removeThemeDescriptor

        public void removeThemeDescriptor(Map<String,Object> params,
                         ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Removes a game theme.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/theme/remove

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.themeDescriptorId
          the theme id
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location used to update the user's current location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • searchThemeDescriptors

        public void searchThemeDescriptors(Map<String,Object> params,
                          ISirqulCallback<PurchaseItemListResponse> callback)
        Searches for game themes.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/theme/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.contestType
          the contest type
        • SirqulKeys.ownerId
          search on contests that an account has access to
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          a keyword to search on
        • SirqulKeys.filters
          list of Enums.Ownership
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          the field to sort by. See Enums.ThemeDescriptorApiMap
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          determines whether the sorted list is in descending or ascending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          the start parameter for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          the limit parameter for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.dateCreated
          filter on items that have been created before this date
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          application version of the theme to filter by
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location used to update the user's current location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        PurchaseItemListResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ThemeDescriptorApiBase.searchThemeDescriptors
